title: Is NCERT enough or not for organic and inorganic chemistry? - Quora
tags: National Council of Educational Research and Training (NCERT)

response.answer_text: Look…it depend on what are you preparing for….. (OVERALL:For inorganic just through NCERT as much times possible…at the end you shall know at which page which point is written …whereas for organic,you have to build concepts starting from GOC(building blocks)…if your concepts are strong you can solve any level question) FOR BOARDS:-Its absolutely enough as the paper generally comes easy. FOR NEET:-Here also NCERT is sufficient (for concept building) as if you see the latest pattern and PYQ….questions asked are mostly from NCERT.Only you need to do is question practicing for which you may choose MS CHAUHAN & VK JAISWAl (*Neet edition) for org. and inog. respectively,or solve any institute study material which you can even find for free on internet. FOR JEE:-Here you need to level up yourself…as core concepts shall be crystal clear…you may reffer to OP Tandon for theory or now a days even many video lectures are available which have more than sufficient matter is you are able to extract.For solving go for any out of MS CHAUHAN or HIMANSHU PANDEY…. Hope it helps you…

For boards - yes, it is enough. You will get everything on ncert itself . But if you are preparing for some competitive exams you have to study from some other sources also. Although for NEET it is said ncert is enough still try to solve questions and build some concepts from other books also. I did it from allen modules. It is all your choice from which book you have to prepare. I hope I was helpful.
